intro: Eriospermum angustissimum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Eriospermum angustissimum is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained environments.
